content.description:
P-1 5.9 100'  Start in the arch and exit it at the first bolt. Face climbing on ledges past another bolt and wires.

P-2 5.10a 80'  This pitch is face climbing past several bolts and ends at the base of the Bastion.
content.location: Further right on Second Tier, below an obvious arch.

content.description: Climb the large arch past the first bolt of Slip Shake to a bolt at a seam over the arch. Follow this crack past another bolt and up to an anchor.

P-1 5.7 90' Line of bolts on the slab.

P-2 5.9+ 90' Move the belay left to another anchor. Continue past several bolts and into the arching crack, past a bolt and into a corner to finish. Rap the route.
content.protection: P-1 10 bolts, P-2 4 bolts, single rack to 3", wires

content.description: Starts in a chimney with a .75 cam, then step out onto the face to the first bolt. All bolts from here on, the route can be done in one 180' pitch if you have enough draws.
content.location:
Far left side of the grassy ledge at the base of 2nd tier. This is a quick way to get to 3rd tier. Also the best rap station to leave 3rd tier.

The route ends below Shadow Dragon.

content.description:
P-1 5.9 90'   a small roof at the base and continue thru small ledges and face with several bolts.

P-2 5.8+ 100'  Follow 4 or 5 bolts on the wide open face to an anchor at 90'. From here scramble up about 40' to a single bolt at the start of Donkey Kong while on belay.
content.location: Right of the arch at a small roof.

content.description:
P-1 5.10a 100' Great edging on the initial slab up to a lt facing dihedral. Move around this to the right (crux) with easier climbing to the anchor.

P-2 5.10a 100' Follow bolts angling up to the roof. A cam protects pulling out the roof to a bolt, then up into a gully. A bolt out left on the face protects another hard move and easier climbing to the anchor. Rap the route or exit to 3rd tier. A 100' rap just reaches the anchor so knot the ends. Same with the next rap.
content.location: About 80' right of Rampart. A 70 meter rope is best for this route although a 60 just makes it.
